sections.1_story: Imagine you have a small cube and you paint its faces, cut it into smaller cubes, or roll a dice to get a number. In exams, cube and dice questions test your ability to visualize 3D objects, their faces, and their positions after various operations.
2_definitions: ğŸ’¡ Cube: A solid figure with six equal square faces.
ğŸ’¡ Dice: A cube with numbers or dots on each face, used in games.
ğŸ’¡ Face: One of the flat surfaces of a cube.
ğŸ’¡ Edge: The line where two faces of a cube meet.
ğŸ’¡ Vertex: The point where three edges meet.
ğŸ’¡ Adjacent Faces: Faces that share a common edge.
ğŸ’¡ Opposite Faces: Faces that are directly across from each other.
ğŸ’¡ Net of a Cube: A two-dimensional figure that can be folded to form a cube.
ğŸ’¡ Painted Cube: A cube whose faces are colored, often cut into smaller cubes.
ğŸ’¡ Standard Dice: A dice where the sum of numbers on opposite faces is always 7.
3_formula_bank: ğŸ§® 1. Number of small cubes after cutting a cube of side n into a Ã— a Ã— a = a^3.
ğŸ§® 2. Number of cubes with 0 faces painted = (n-2)^3 (for n > 2).
ğŸ§® 3. Number of cubes with 1 face painted = 6(n-2)^2 (for n > 2).
ğŸ§® 4. Number of cubes with 2 faces painted = 12(n-2) (for n > 2).
ğŸ§® 5. Number of cubes with 3 faces painted = 8 (always at the corners).
ğŸ§® 6. Total number of faces in a cube = 6.
ğŸ§® 7. Total number of edges in a cube = 12.
ğŸ§® 8. Total number of vertices in a cube = 8.
ğŸ§® 9. For a standard dice, sum of opposite faces = 7.
ğŸ§® 10. If two adjacent faces show 2 and 3, opposite faces are 5 and 4.
ğŸ§® 11. Number of cubes with no paint = (n-2)^3.
ğŸ§® 12. Number of cubes with paint on 2 faces = 12(n-2).
ğŸ§® 13. Number of cubes with paint on 3 faces = 8.
ğŸ§® 14. Number of cubes with paint on 1 face = 6(n-2)^2.
ğŸ§® 15. Number of cubes with paint on 0 face = (n-2)^3.
ğŸ§® 16. For a cube of side n, total small cubes = n^3.
ğŸ§® 17. For a dice, opposite faces never share an edge.
ğŸ§® 18. In a net, adjacent faces are connected by an edge.
ğŸ§® 19. In a net, opposite faces are not connected directly.

4_micro_examples: A cube of side 3 is cut into 27 small cubes.
A cube of side 4 is cut into 64 small cubes.
A cube of side 5 is cut into 125 small cubes.
A cube of side 3, painted on all faces, has 1 small cube with no paint.
A cube of side 4, painted on all faces, has 8 small cubes with 3 faces painted.
A standard dice has opposite faces 1-6, 2-5, 3-4.
If two adjacent faces of a dice show 2 and 3, opposite faces are 5 and 4.

5_exam_examples.problem: A cube of side 4 cm is painted on all faces and then cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have paint on exactly 2 faces?
A cube of side 5 cm is painted on all faces and cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have paint on exactly 1 face?
A cube of side 3 cm is painted on all faces and cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have no paint?
On a standard dice, if one face shows 2, what is the number on the opposite face?
A cube has how many edges?
A cube has how many vertices?
A cube has how many faces?
If two adjacent faces of a dice show 3 and 4, what are the numbers on their opposite faces?
solution_steps: Opposite of 3 is 4, opposite of 4 is 3.

5_exam_examples.problem: A cube of side 2 cm is painted on all faces and cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have paint on 3 faces?
A cube of side 6 cm is painted on all faces and cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have paint on no face?
A cube of side 3 cm is painted on all faces and cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have paint on 2 faces?
A cube of side 4 cm is painted on all faces and cut into 1 cm cubes. How many cubes will have paint on 3 faces?
